repeater.name: Repeater
repeater.description: A device in which one fuse lights and ignites a series of small mortars at once, these can contain up to 500 grams of gunpowder and offer a very exciting display.

roman_candles.name: Roman Candles
roman_candles.description: A long tube that fires small balls of light in succession to one another. They can have as few as 5 shots, or as many as 200 shots.

fountains.name: Fountains
fountains.description: Multi-colored sparklers that are safe for any age.

thunder_king.name: 100 Shot Thunder King w/ White Glitter Bouquet
thunder_king.description: Continuous, green tails to flash report.

blue-brocade.name: 49 Shot Blue Brocade & Mines
blue-brocade.description: Bluetail to Brocade Crown & Blue Stars w/Blue Stars Mine.

friendship.name: 100 Shot Friendship
friendship.description: fan shaped, silver spinners w/ red dahlia shells.

fairy_sparklers.name: Fairy Sparklers
fairy_sparklers.description: Multi-colored sparklers that are safe for any age.

party_poppers.name: Party Poppers
party_poppers.description: Once a string is pulled to activate the charge, confetti is thrust into the air and produces a report.

snakes.name: Snakes
snakes.description: a small compressed pellet that, when lit, expands into a long snake-like object.

acetone_peroxide.name: Acetone peroxide
acetone_peroxide.description: An organic peroxide and a primary high explosive. It is produced by the oxidation of acetone to yield a mixture of linear monomer and cyclic dimer, trimer, and tetramer forms.

ammonium_permanganate.name: Ammonium permanganate
ammonium_permanganate.description: A moderately strong explosive, owing to the combination of oxidizer permanganate anion and reducing ammonium cation.

fulminic_acid.name: Fulminic acid
fulminic_acid.description: very dangerous, and are often used as detonators for other explosive materials.

tnt.name: TNT
tnt.description: An explosive material with convenient handling properties.

rdx.name: RDX
rdx.description: A more energetic explosive than TNT, it was used widely in World War II.

dynomite.name: Dynomite
dynomite.description: An explosive made of nitroglycerin, sorbents and stabilizers.

anfo.name: ANFO
anfo.description: A widely used bulk industrial explosive mixture.

wet-get-explosive.name: Wet Gel Explosive
wet-get-explosive.description: A fuel sensitized explosive mixture consisting of an aqueous ammonium nitrate solution that acts as the oxidizer.

f_bomb.name: F Bomb
f_bomb.description: Multi-colored word that is safe for any age.
